item.title: The difficulty of innovating quickly enough to ensure a comfortable life until the age of 100
item.description: An on-site poll at The Longevity Summit – Is Asia ready for 100? in Singapore revealed that the majority (60%) of the 200 Asian business leaders, government officials, and healthcare professionals present didn’t believe the current pace of innovation could address the challenges of increasing longevity. Attendees convened to explore how to better integrate Asia’s senior population into the workforce and promote healthier, longer lives. A Call for Total Change Kanwaljit Soin, Founding President of Women’s Initiative for Ageing Successfully, emphasized the need to overhaul the current linear life model.
